titleStmt.title: The sentiments of N.N. (a loyal subject of the Roman Catholick communion) touching the Roman consistorie's designs and practices, by and with their correspondents here, (viz. the Jesuits, monks and friers) to the prejudice of this nation, and the future involving it in misery and trouble, under the (feigned) pretence of advancing Catholick religion : together with some general remedies or expedients for preventing thereof, expresses in certain propositions, and humbly submitted to the censure of those whose prudence, or authority inables them better to judge of things.
titleStmt.author: N. N., loyal subject of the Roman Catholick communion.

notesStmt.note: At end: "N.N. First written, April 12th, 1669. Revised, with some small additions, Septemb. 2. 1679."
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
